results.title: Statin treatment and accrual of covert cerebral ischaemia on neuroimaging: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized trials.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: Data from three randomized controlled trials (1430 participants) were included evaluating the effect of @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@rosuvastatin@@@ (10 mg/day) in 668 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ older than 60 years of age over 5 years, @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@ (40 mg/day) in 554 elderly @SPECIES_9606 @@@people@@@ more than 70 years of age over 3 years and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (20 mg/day) in 208 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with asymptomatic @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@middle cerebral artery stenosis@@@ over 2 years.

citations.NLM: Katsanos AH, Lioutas VA, Charidimou A, Catanese L, Ng KKH, Perera K, de Sa Boasquevisque D, Tsivgoulis G, Smith EE, Sharma M, Selim MH, Shoamanesh A. Statin treatment and accrual of covert cerebral ischaemia on neuroimaging: a systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized trials. Eur J Neurol. 2020 Jun;27(6):1023-1027. PMID: 32133735

results.title: Simvastatin increases notch signaling activity and promotes arteriogenesis after stroke.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@ were subjected to @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@MCAo@@@ and treated with or without @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ daily for 7 days.

results.title: Acute neurovascular unit protection by simvastatin in transient cerebral ischemia.
results.text_hl: After 30 minutes of @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@MCA occlusion@@@, four @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ each were subcutaneously injected with either 20 or 40 mg/kg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Nagaraja TN, Knight RA, Croxen RL, Konda KP, Fenstermacher JD. Acute neurovascular unit protection by simvastatin in transient cerebral ischemia. Neurol Res. 2006 Dec;28(8):826-30. PMID: 17288739

results.title: Reduction of cerebral infarction in stroke-prone spontaneously hypertensive rats by statins associated with amelioration of oxidative stress.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ significantly reduced immunoreactivities for oxidative stress markers for @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipids@@@ and DNA in neurons after @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@tMCAO@@@.

results.title: Combination treatment of stroke with sub-therapeutic doses of Simvastatin and human umbilical cord blood cells enhances vascular remodeling and improves functional outcome.
results.text_hl: There was no significant difference between @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@- or HUCBC-monotherapy and @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@MCAo@@@-alone group.

results.title: Pretreatment with simvastatin upregulates expression of BK-2R and CD11b in the ischemic penumbra of rats
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_10116 @@@Rats@@@ were pretreated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 14 days prior to @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@MCAO@@@ induction.

results.title: Activation of NF-kB and ERK1/2 after permanent focal ischemia is abolished by simvastatin treatment.
results.text_hl: We investigated the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ treatment on the expression of @GENE_IL1B @GENE_24494 @@@IL-1beta@@@ and @GENE_MCPT1L1 @GENE_100360872 @@@MCP-1@@@, the activity of @GENE_RELA @GENE_309165 @@@NF-kB@@@, and the signaling pathways related to @GENE_RELA @GENE_309165 @@@NF-kB@@@ activation in a @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model of permanent @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@middle cerebral artery occlusion@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@pMCAO@@@).

results.title: Combination treatment of experimental stroke with Niaspan and Simvastatin, reduces axonal damage and improves functional outcome.
results.text_hl: Adult male @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ were subjected to 2 h @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@middle cerebral artery occlusion@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@MCAo@@@) and treated with or without @CHEMICAL_Niacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009525 @@@Niaspan@@@ alone, @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ alone and combination @CHEMICAL_Niacin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009525 @@@Niaspan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ starting 24 h after @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@MCAo@@@ and daily for 14 days.

citations.NLM: Shehadah A, Chen J, Cui X, Roberts C, Lu M, Chopp M. Combination treatment of experimental stroke with Niaspan and Simvastatin, reduces axonal damage and improves functional outcome. J Neurol Sci. 2010 Jul 15;294(1-2):107-11. PMID: 20451219

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates stroke-induced splenic atrophy and lung susceptibility to spontaneous bacterial infection in mice.
results.text_hl: Animals were randomly assigned to sham and @<m>DISEASE_Infarction_Middle_Cerebral_Artery</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D020244 @@@middle cerebral artery occlusion@@@ groups treated subcutaneously with vehicle or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (20 mg/kg per day).
